attributes.action: Add the coronavirus vaccine to the NHS vaccination schedule
attributes.additional_details: The NHS stresses that vaccines protect you from serious and potentially deadly diseases. Since vaccines were introduced to the UK, disease that used to kill or disabled millions of people are gone or rarely seen. With the proper implementation of coronavirus vaccination, COVID -19 can become another disease that no longer affects our lives seriously. In order to achieve this, the coronavirus vaccine must be added to the NHS vaccination schedule.
attributes.background: To ensure our community is fully protected we must add the coronavirus vaccines to the NHS vaccination schedule, normalising receiving the coronavirus vaccine to protect people around us.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a l clinicadecision for the NHS, to be taken in consultation with the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI)
